body: \text{Show that the function } f(x) = |x| \text{ is continuous at } x = 0 \text{ but not differentiable at } x = 0.
\text{If } f(x) = x^3 + 3x^2 + 6x + 2 \text{, show that } f(x) \text{ is continuous for all } x \in \mathbb{R} \text{ but differentiable at } x = -1.
\text{Determine the derivative of the composite function } f(g(x)) \text{, where } f(x) = \sin(x) \text{ and } g(x) = x^2 + 2x.
\text{Using logarithmic differentiation, find } \frac{dy}{dx} \text{ for } y = x^x.
\text{Show that every polynomial function is continuous everywhere.}
\text{Find all points of discontinuity of the greatest integer function } f(x) = \lfloor x \rfloor \text{ on } \mathbb{R}.
\text{If } f(x) = x^2 \sin \left( \frac{1}{x} \right) \text{ for } x \neq 0 \text{ and } f(0) = 0 \text{, determine if } f(x) \text{ is continuous at } x = 0.
\text{Prove that } f(x) = \cos(x^2) \text{ is continuous for all real } x.
\text{Examine the continuity of the function } f(x) = \frac{|x|}{x} \text{ at } x = 0.
\text{Using the chain rule, differentiate } f(x) = \sin(3x^2 + 2x).
\text{Find the derivative of the function } y = \ln(\cos(x) + x).
\text{Differentiate } y = \arcsin(x) + \arccos(x).
\text{Evaluate } \frac{d}{dx} \left( \frac{\sin(x)}{x} \right) \text{ using L'Hôpital's Rule at } x = 0.
\text{Show that } f(x) = e^{x} \cos(x) \text{ is continuous for all } x \in \mathbb{R}.
\text{Find } \frac{dy}{dx} \text{ if } y = \sin^{-1} \left( \frac{x}{\sqrt{1 + x^2}} \right).
\text{Show that the function } f(x) = x^2 \cos \left( \frac{1}{x} \right) \text{ is continuous at } x = 0.
\text{If } f(x) = e^{x^2}, \text{ prove that } f(x) \text{ is differentiable for all real } x.
\text{Evaluate the limit } \lim_{x \to 0} \frac{\sin(x) - x}{x^3}.
\text{Differentiate } y = \frac{e^{3x}}{\sqrt{x}} \text{ with respect to } x.
\text{If } f(x) = |x + 2| \text{, determine the points at which } f(x) \text{ is not differentiable.}
\text{Find the derivative of } y = x^{x^2}.
\text{If } f(x) = \sin(x) \text{ for } x \neq 0 \text{ and } f(0) = 0 \text{, determine if } f(x) \text{ is continuous at } x = 0.
\text{Determine if } f(x) = x^x \text{ is continuous at } x = 0.
\text{Use L'Hôpital's Rule to evaluate } \lim_{x \to 0} \frac{e^{2x} - 1}{x}.
\text{If } y = \cos^{-1} \left( \frac{2x}{1 + x^2} \right), \text{ find } \frac{dy}{dx}.
\text{Find the second derivative of } y = \tan^{-1}(x).
\text{If } f(x) = x^2 e^x \text{, prove that } f(x) \text{ is continuous and differentiable for all } x \in \mathbb{R}.
\text{Show that } f(x) = x \sin \left( \frac{1}{x} \right) \text{ is continuous at } x = 0.
\text{Differentiate the function } f(x) = \ln(x^2 + x + 1) \text{ using chain rule.}
